meanings.definition: The ability to induce cell division.
meanings.sent1: The mitogenicity of the substance triggered rapid cell division in the experiment.
meanings.sent2: Scientists study the mitogenicity of different compounds to understand their impact on cell growth.
meanings.sent3: The mitogenicity of the fertilizer was so strong that the plants grew like crazy!
meanings.sent4: Her enthusiasm for gardening had a mitogenicity that spread to all her friends, inspiring them to plant their own gardens.
meanings.sent5: The mitogenicity of the music festival was evident in the way it brought people together and energized the crowd.

meanings.definition: The quality of promoting cell growth.
meanings.sent1: The mitogenicity of the hormone was crucial for the development of new tissues.
meanings.sent2: Certain nutrients in the diet can enhance the mitogenicity of cells in the body.
meanings.sent3: The mitogenicity of the plant fertilizer was so effective that the flowers bloomed in record time.
meanings.sent4: His positive attitude had a mitogenicity that seemed to encourage growth and progress in those around him.
meanings.sent5: The mitogenicity of the skincare product was evident in the way it rejuvenated the skin and promoted a healthy glow.
